cluster_relations.rel_desc: Athletes collaborate and direct their efforts toward a shared common goal.
Athletes learn how to deal with success as part of sports participation.
Athletes learn how to deal with failure as part of sports participation.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an agent directs effort toward achieving a specified goal.
args.justification: The relation connects athletes to a common goal in a collaborative, goal-oriented manner; the core predicate is that the athletes are actively working toward (pursuing) that goal.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an agent acquires or develops the capability to effectively handle or cope with a particular outcome or situation.
args.justification: Both relations describe athletes learning how to deal with a type of performance outcome (success or failure) through sports experiences; semantically this is the acquisition of the ability to handle those outcomes, so a single canonical predicate fits both.

The link expresses a motivational/goal-directed relationship between an agent (athletes) and a goal (common goal), fitting a class focused on goals and motivation rather than skill acquisition or composition.

Both relations describe athletes developing coping/handling skills regarding performance outcomes (success or failure), which are psychosocial abilities gained through experience; they naturally belong to a psychosocial skill acquisition class.
Pursuing a goal is an agentive, intentional action directed toward an outcome, which fits the broad AGENCY dimension better than composition, identity, or temporality.

These relations capture a change in the athletes themselves (they develop new abilities to handle success or failure) rather than a static property or simple association, fitting a broad MODIFICATION group focused on development or change in state.
